unnormalised: ## Ditch the CDs, Embrace the Vibe: Music Streaming is the New Bollywood Anthem!
normalised: ## Ditch the C D s, Embrace the Vibe: Music Streaming is the New Bollywood Anthem!

unnormalised: Hey guys, remember the days of hoarding CDs and religiously tuning into Radio Mirchi hoping to catch your favorite Bollywood track? Yeah, those days are *so* passé! We're living in the age of music streaming, and honestly, it's a game-changer.
normalised: Hey guys, remember the days of hoarding C D s and religiously tuning into Radio Mirchi hoping to catch your favorite Bollywood track? Yeah, those days are *so* passé! We're living in the age of music streaming, and honestly, it's a game-changer.

unnormalised: Think about it: instant access to practically *every* song you can imagine, right at your fingertips. From the latest Arijit Singh ballad to classic Kishore Kumar hits, it's all there. No more trekking all the way to Rhythm House in Colaba (RIP!) to hunt down that one album.
normalised: Think about it: instant access to practically *every* song you can imagine, right at your fingertips. From the latest Arijit Singh ballad to classic Kishore Kumar hits, it's all there. No more trekking all the way to Rhythm House in Colaba (R I P!) to hunt down that one album.

unnormalised: I remember back in my college days at IIT Delhi, during fresher's week, everyone would be blasting music from their laptops. But the selection was always limited, and sharing songs involved a complicated network of pen drives and Bluetooth transfers. Now, thanks to Spotify, Gaana, JioSaavn, and Apple Music, organizing the college fest playlist is a breeze.
normalised: I remember back in my college days at I I T Delhi, during fresher's week, everyone would be blasting music from their laptops. But the selection was always limited, and sharing songs involved a complicated network of pen drives and Bluetooth transfers. Now, thanks to Spotify, Gaana, JioSaavn, and Apple Music, organizing the college fest playlist is a breeze.

unnormalised: Plus, these platforms are smart! They learn your taste over time and curate playlists just for you. Suddenly you’re discovering gems you never knew existed, from Rajasthani folk music to Indie artists from Bangalore. It’s like having a personal DJ, 24/7.

unnormalised: And the best part? It’s super affordable. For just a few hundred Rupees a month, you get access to millions of songs ad-free. That's cheaper than buying a single CD back in the day!

unnormalised: Think about the movie "Rockstar". Imagine Jordan, played by Ranbir Kapoor, composing his music and then immediately uploading it to a streaming platform for his fans to enjoy. That's the power we have now!

unnormalised: So, whether you’re chilling with a cup of chai in your balcony in Delhi or stuck in Bangalore traffic, put on your headphones and let the music flow. Ditch those dusty CDs and embrace the future of music. You won't regret it! What are your favourite music streaming platforms, guys? Let me know in the comments!
